meanings.definition: Not capable of being reformed or improved.
meanings.sent1: The old, irreformable building stood tall despite its age.
meanings.sent2: Her decision to quit her job was irreformable, no matter what anyone said.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat was irreformable in its refusal to eat anything but tuna.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were a reminder of the irreformable passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The rusted lock was irreformable, no longer able to be opened.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being changed or altered.
meanings.sent1: The rules of the game were irreformable, set in stone by the referee.
meanings.sent2: His opinion on the matter was irreformable, despite others' attempts to sway him.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast seemed irreformable, predicting rain every day.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range was an irreformable barrier, blocking their path.
meanings.sent5: The contract was irreformable, with no room for negotiation.
